'THY Turkish Airlines' (Turkish: TÃ¼rk Hava YollarÄ±) () is the national flag
carrier airline of Turkey, headquartered at the Turkish Airlines General
Management Building on the grounds of AtatÃ¼rk Airport in YeÅilkÃ¶y, BakÄ±rkÃ¶y, Istanbul. "[http://www.thy.com/en-
INT/corporate/contact_us/index.aspx Contact Us]." Turkish Airlines. Retrieved on
26 June 2010. "Turkish Airlines General Management Turkish Airlines General
Management Building AtatÃ¼rk Airport, Yesilkoy 34149 Istanbul
Turkey" "[http://www.thy.com/images/Image/icerik/THY_Maps_EN.png
Map]." Turkish Airlines. Retrieved on 26 June 2010. It operates scheduled
services to 197 international and 37 domestic airports, serving a total of 234
airports, in Europe, Asia, Africa, and the Americas as of June 2013. With an
increase to 103 destination countries, the carrier's destination network from
one hub is the world's largest. Also with 234 destination numbers, the airline
4th biggest carrier in the world by number of destinations. The
airline's main base is at AtatÃ¼rk International Airport, with secondary hubs at
EsenboÄa International Airport, Antalya International Airport, Sabiha GÃ¶kÃ§en
International Airport, and Adnan Menderes Airport. In 2006, 2007, 2008, 2009,
2010, 2011 and 2012 THY carried 17.0 million, 19.7 million, 22.5 million, 25.1
million, 29 million, 32.6 million and 39,0 million passengers with total
revenues of US$2.23, $3.0, $4.5, $4.0, $5.6, $7.1 and $9.0 billion,
respectively. [http://www.atwonline.com/news/story.html?storyID=6958 ATW
Daily News] [http://www.thy.com/en-
INT/corporate/news/press_room/press_releases/press_release.aspx?pid=4258 Turkish
Airlines nine month net profit 304 million USD â Turkish Airlines â TK â
International Home Page]. Thy.com. Retrieved on 2010-12-16.

The airline has 15,679 employees. THY has been a member of the Star Alliance
network since 1 April 2008.

Other airline companies that are/were owned or co-owned by Turkish
Airlines include AnadoluJet, SunExpress, Cyprus Turkish Airlines and North
Cyprus Airlines.

From April 2010 "TURKISH" replaced "TURKAIR" on the ICAO Official
allocated callsign.
categories: Companies listed on the Istanbul Stock Exchange
